messages.title: The Greens are within yards of the finishing post
messages.content: Opinion polls show potential for Green victory. ICM poll results put the Greens on course to win Brighton Pavilion MP seat at the next General Election. 63% of Labour and Lib Dem voters said they would be likely to switch their vote to the Greens to stop the Tories.

mentions.tacticalSituation: ICM poll results put the Greens on course to win Brighton Pavilion MP seat at the next General Election. 63% of Labour and Lib Dem voters said they would be likely to switch their vote to the Greens to stop the Tories.

leaflet.personalStatement: Caroline Lucas: a strong voice for Brighton

quotes.text: With contrasting figures, I would put my faith in ICM [Green poll] rather than Kindle [an opinion poll quoted by Labour].
quotes.source: Anthony Wells, Editor of UK Polling Report

images.caption: ICM Research interviewed a random sample of 533 adults aged 18+ by telephone on 16-21st December 2009. Activities and profile of Liaison were weighted to be representative of all Brighton Pavilion adults aged 18+. ICM is a member of the British Polling Council and abides by its rules.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Greens use accredited British Polling Council member polling companies such as ICM Research. Election experts back Greens' polling.
